parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Visible form, shape, appearance, outward show, kind, species, class. From eido; a view, i.e. Form.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A collective word: raiment, clothing. From himatizo; clothing.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To flash forth like lightning, gleam, be radiant. From ek and astrapto; to lighten forth, i.e. to be radiant.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
